net.sourceforge.waters.analysis
Class ControllabilityChecker

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.ModelChecker
      net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.ControllabilityChecker
public class ControllabilityChecker
extends ModelChecker

A dummy implementation of a controllability checker.

The run() method of this model checker does nothing, and simply claims that every model is controllable.

Author:
Robi Malik
See Also:
ModelChecker

getResult

public boolean getResult()
Gets the result of controllability checking.

Specified by:
getResult in class ModelChecker
Returns:
true if the model was found to be controllable, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - in all cases, because this method is not yet implemented.

getCounterExample

public List getCounterExample()
Gets a counterexample if the model was found to be not controllable.

Specified by:
getCounterExample in class ModelChecker
Returns:
A list of events of type EventProxy representing a controllability error trace. A controllability error trace is a nonempty sequence of events such that all except the last event in the list can be executed by the model. The last event in list is an uncontrollable event that is possible in all plant automata, but not in all specification automata present in the model. Thus, the last step demonstrates why the model is not controllable.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - in all cases, because this method is not yet implemented.
